item.title: Linux Artifacts
item.description: User Data /home/$USER - user data and configs Password hashes etc/passwd etc/shadow Notifications Configurations /etc[%SystemRoot%]/System32/config - contains separate configs for each application

item.title: Linux Core Processes
item.description: There are two broad categories of core processes. Processes that initialize system environment and those that initialize the user environment. Whatever is the category, you need to know them well in order to detect abnormal things.

item.title: Linux OS Primer
item.description: System Boot Init is the process that spawns other processes and usually has pid 1. /etc/inittab can be used to set run level for the systems.
